text.section:
On behalf of a minor, a parent or guardian of the person of the minor may apply, under this section, for admission of the minor to:
Any facility that is not a State facility; or
The following State facilities:
A regional institute for children and adolescents; and
The child or adolescent unit of a State facility.
The applicant shall submit a formal, written application that contains the personal information and is on the form required by the Administration.

A facility may not admit an individual under this section unless:
The individual has a mental disorder;
The mental disorder is susceptible to care or treatment;
The applicant understands the nature of a request for admission; and
Assent to the admission has been given:
By the admitting physician of the facility; or
For a child or adolescent unit of a State facility, by a physician and psychologist or by 2 physicians.
An admission under this section to a child or adolescent unit of a State facility may not exceed 20 days.
